title: InputData
description: A toggle switch widget for displaying and controlling binary device states. Use this widget to show ON/OFF status indicators that can also trigger device actions when clicked. Supports configurable state mapping to interpret various data values as ON, OFF, or UNKNOWN states. When connected to a device action, clicking the switch sends commands to control physical devices or trigger backend operations. Multiple switches can be displayed in one widget. Ideal for IoT device control panels, smart home interfaces, equipment control dashboards, or any scenario requiring visual toggle controls with action capabilities.

title.title: Title
title.description: The main heading displayed above the switch controls. Use to describe the control group (e.g., 'Light Controls', 'Pump Switches').

subTitle.title: Subtitle
subTitle.description: Secondary text displayed below the title. Use for additional context like location, device group, or instructions.

dataseries.title: Switches
dataseries.description: Array of switch configurations. Each entry creates a toggle switch with its own state mapping and optional device action binding.

label.title: Label
label.description: Display text identifying this switch. Should clearly describe what the switch controls (e.g., 'Main Power', 'Pump 1', 'Night Mode').

stateMap.title: State Map
stateMap.description: Defines how data values are interpreted as switch states. Configure which values represent ON and OFF. Values not matching either state display as UNKNOWN (neutral position).

on.title: ON Values
on.description: Values that indicate the ON state. Can be: a single value ('1', 'true', 'ON'), comma-separated list ('1,true,ON'), or numeric expression ('<4' means values below 4 are ON, '>33' means values above 33 are ON). If a value matches both ON and OFF, ON takes precedence.

off.title: OFF Values
off.description: Values that indicate the OFF state. Can be: a single value ('0', 'false', 'OFF'), comma-separated list ('0,false,OFF'), or numeric expression ('<4' means values below 4 are OFF, '>33' means values above 33 are OFF). Values matching neither ON nor OFF show as UNKNOWN.

value.title: Switch State
value.description: The current state value from the backend, used to display the correct switch position. Strongly recommended to bind this to the actual device state column to keep the visual state synchronized with the physical device state.

actionDevice.title: Action Device Target
actionDevice.description: The device that receives commands when the switch is clicked. In data-driven mode, bind to a 'Device ID' column to dynamically target different devices per row.

actionApp.title: Action App
actionApp.description: The application/service on the target device that handles the switch command. Select from available apps installed on the device.

actionTopic.title: Action App Topic
actionTopic.description: The specific command/topic sent to the app when the switch is clicked. Arguments sent are: True for turning ON, False for turning OFF. Refer to the app's documentation for available topics.

styling.title: Styling
styling.description: Visual styling options for the switch and its label.

labelColor.title: Label Color
labelColor.description: Color of the switch label text.

valueColor.title: Value Color
valueColor.description: Color of the state value text displayed with the switch.
